conclusion: Analyze forces on particle before and after metal plate removal.
Particle P is stationary, net force is zero.
Forces on P: electric force and gravitational force.
Electric field E between plates is V/d.
Electric force on particle is qE.
Electric force balances gravitational force: qE = mg.
Substitute E: q(V/d) = mg.
After removal, effective distance is d - l.
New electric field E' is V/(d - l).
New electric force on particle is qE'.
Net force is qE' - mg.
Substitute E': F_net = q(V/(d - l)) - mg.
Express mg as q(V/d).
Substitute mg: F_net = q(V/(d - l)) - q(V/d).
Factor out qV: F_net = qV(1/(d - l) - 1/d).
Simplify: (1/(d - l) - 1/d) = l/(d(d - l)).
F_net = qV(l/(d(d - l))).
Net force F_net relates to acceleration a by F_net = ma.
Substitute F_net: ma = qV(l/(d(d - l))).
Solve for a: a = (qV/m)(l/(d(d - l))).
